result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Lavell Henry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terry Lavell Henry appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Conrardy to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate to be determined at the conclusion of the case.  Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Terry Lavell Henry in court.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court will schedule case for status of counsel by zoom.  Defendant was given next court date and zoom instructions.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court orders  bail to be returned to the person who posted.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TLH

Defendant Terry Lavell Henry in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/25/22 @ 1p
